thread.title: Collierville High cross country coach dies
thread.title_full: Collierville High cross country coach dies

author: John Varlas
title: Collierville High cross country coach dies
text:
Collierville High cross country coach Robbie Simmons has died.
A post on the school's Facebook page Sunday stated: "Our thoughts and prayers are with the family of CHS teacher Robbie Simmons who died this weekend. He will be greatly missed by his family, his students, the CHS faculty and the Collierville Schools community."
This fall was Simmons' 14th season as coach of the boys and girls cross-country teams. A native of West Memphis, he ran cross country and track in high school, winning the state cross country championship as a junior.
He earned a track scholarship to Baylor before transferring to Ouachita Baptist, where he earned NAIA all-American honors as a marathoner.
Heading into the season, Simmons' girls teams had won the region championship in five of the last eight years while placing third in the state in 2005. Collierville's boys won the region title in 2014 after a string of runner-up finishes.
The school's Facebook post said grief counselors would be at the school when students return from fall break next week.
